page.title: 09A DEER WARDEN'S DAY.
page.content: Mr.R.Elsworth is a deer warden at Dunham Park.He goes to the Park every Wednesday and Friday.All the wardens are volunteers and receive no payment. They do it because they enjoy the work.They first check that no deer has been mislayed.In spring they check for births of new fawns and keep a record.Their main job is to make sure that the public do not feed the deer or harass.Sadly accidents do happen to both deer and visitors.Over 200 deer roam free in the park equalled in number only by the grey squirrels.Thepark is over 250 acres and there is a deer barn and a deer sanctuary.2,000 trees also provide shelter for the deer.
